Bundles of debt: how lenders sidestep Canada's mortgage rules
item.description: [Reuters] - Canada's subprime mortgage providers are increasingly teaming up with unregulated rivals to sidestep rules designed to clamp down on risky lending. The arrangements have proliferated, mortgage brokers told Reuters, as Canadian regulators have tightened lending standards to shield borrowers in case a decade-long housing boom goes bust. The practice has grown fast because it allows borrowers to make down payments of just 10 percent, dodging federal rules that require either 20 or 35 percent down on mortgages not backed by government insurance, according to industry experts.

Home Capital Group Inc. announces renewal of Normal Course Issuer Bid
item.description: [CNW Group] - Home Capital Group Inc. announces renewal of Normal Course Issuer Bid

item.title: Home Capital Group Inc. announces renewal of Normal Course Issuer Bid
item.description: [PR Newswire] - TORONTO, Dec. 23, 2016 /CNW/ - Home Capital Group Inc. (HCG.TO) announced today that it has filed with the Toronto Stock Exchange ("TSX") a Notice of Intention to make a Normal Course Issuer Bid, as approved by Home Capital's Board of Directors, pursuant to which Home Capital may purchase for cancellation up to 5,336,040 of its Common Shares, representing approximately 10% of its public float as of December 19, 2016 (being 5,920,340 Common Shares, calculated in accordance with TSX rules) less the number of Common Shares repurchased under Home Capital's normal course issuer bid which commenced September 16, 2016. The average daily trading volume of Home Capital's Common Shares from June 1, 2016 to November 30, 2016 was 247,806 Common Shares.
